page.title: 17The Oil Industry and Aboyne
page.content: The discovery of oil in the North Sea has had a major effect on the north of Scotland. The oil{industry}is one of the main reasons for the rapid increase in developments and {population}in Aboyne. The oil industry has brought a lot more work into the area. In a survey carried out on one street of seventeen owner occupied houses it was discovered that in eleven out of the seventeen households the{employment}of the main wage earner was in the{oil industry.} From 1961 to 1971 the increase in the population of Aboyne was only 28, from 1012 to 1040. From 1971 to 1981 there was a population increase of 489 from 1040 to 1529, showing that the discovery of oil in the North Sea had a dramatic effect on the number of people living in Aboyne.
